content: Nach dem Kauf eines BMW hat man eine gewisse Summe entrichtet, die dem Premiumsegment entspricht. Letztlich jedoch werden fÃ¼r moderne Funktionen Abo-Modelle erforderlich, wobei der Funktionsumfang nicht Premium ist. Service wÃ¤re es, die wenigen Funktionen bereits im eigentlichen Fahrzeugpreis Ã¼ber die durchschnittliche Nutzungsdauer zu integrieren. In Anbetracht dessen, dass BMW ohnehin eine permanente Datenabfrage mit jeweiligen Fahrzeugen unternimmt, ist das Preis-/LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis schlecht
content_english: After purchasing a BMW, one pays a certain amount that corresponds to the premium segment. Ultimately, however, subscription models are required for modern features, where the feature scope is not premium. It would be more reasonable to integrate those few functionalities already in the actual vehicle price during the average usage period. Considering that BMW continuously performs data queries with individual vehicles anyway, the price-to-performance ratio is poor.

In spring it said "Consumption less than 69% of other drivers", at the same time "more CO2 than 88% of other drivers."

content_english: After today's update, all connected cars were missing in the app, i.e., no charging history anymore, etc. Even after adding them again in the car, only a demo vehicle is displayed! This can't be true; I thought something like this wouldn't happen with BMW! Update: About 6 hours after re-adding the vehicles, they are back in the app (with historical data). However, only 1 ðŸŒŸ for the initial shock; the cumbersome new manual addition shouldn't be allowed!
